p: Virus uptake through CLRs depends on the level of influenza virus HA (but not NA) glycosylation [ 22]. Increased HA glycosylation, and glycosylation at specific positions, resulted in a higher level of influenza infection in both macrophages [ 20] and DCs [ 23, 24, 133]. Interaction between CLRs and glycans on HA may represent an important route for infection of macrophages and DCs immune cells with influenza viruses.
